project_description: As part of the GAAS genomic tool execution and development, Adult hybrid striped bass were collected in April 2006 from a 5x2 m open­air aquaculture pond in San Diego, California, USA. Each fish was classified as healthy or morbid by veterinarians upon visual inspection. Fish were sacrificed with an overdose of MS­222 (Finquel, Argent Laboratories), and examined for the presence of gross external and internal lesions to confirm preliminary diagnoses. Symptomatic fish had empty gut contents. Five symptomatic and five asymptomatic fish were selected and gut contents were collected by flushing aseptically with 10 mL of SM buffer. Samples were sonicated (15 seconds, 3 times) and then centrifuged at 150 x g for 20 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was then filtered (0.45 μm and 0.2 μm) to separate the microbial fraction (attached onto the filter) from the viruses (filtrate). Viral particles in the filtrate were purified using a CsCl step gradient and viral DNA was extracted as described by Thurber . Viral DNA was amplified with GenomiPhi (GE Healthcare, Piscataway, NJ) and ethanol precipitated. Approximately 10 μg of each DNA sample was submitted for GS20 pyrosequencing at 454 Life Sciences to produce the FishHealGutKentSTVir20060504 and FishMorGutKentSTVir20060504 metagenomes (from healthy fish and morbid fish respectively). Duplicate sequences were removed and the metagenomes were submitted to NCBI (Genome Project 28397 and 28399).
PI_organization: Biology Department, San Diego State University

samp_collect_device: Adult hybrid striped bass were collected in April 2006 from a 5x2 m open­air aquaculture pond in San Diego, California, USA. Each fish was classified as healthy or morbid by veterinarians upon visual inspection. Fish were sacrificed with an overdose of MS­222 (Finquel, Argent Laboratories), and examined for the presence of gross external and internal lesions to confirm preliminary diagnoses. Symptomatic fish had empty gut contents. Five symptomatic and five asymptomatic fish were selected and gut contents were collected by flushing aseptically with 10 mL of SM buffer. Samples were sonicated (15 seconds, 3 times) and then centrifuged at 150 x g for 20 minutes at 4°C. The supernatant was then filtered (0.45 μm and 0.2 μm) to separate the microbial fraction (attached onto the filter) from the viruses (filtrate). Viral particles in the filtrate were purified using a CsCl step gradient and viral DNA was extracted as described by Thurber [5].
location: San Diego University, San Diego, California

seq_center.definition: Name of instatute sequencing was done

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

investigation_type.definition: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/16S rRNA sequencing

seq_meth.definition: Sequencing method used. Use one of: Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid, 454, Illumina, assembeled, other

metagenome_name.definition: Unique name for the sequences from this library
metagenome_name.value: Kent State SeaTech Healthy Fish Gut Microbial Sample2

biome.definition: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

samp_collect_device.definition: The method or device employed for isolating/collecting the sample
samp_collect_device.value: Adult hybrid striped bass were collected in April 2006 from a 5x2 m open­air aquaculture pond in San Diego, California, USA. Each fish was classified as healthy or morbid by veterinarians upon visual inspection. Fish were sacrificed with an overdose of MS­222 (Finquel, Argent Laboratories), and examined for the presence of gross external and internal lesions to confirm preliminary diagnoses. env_package.definition: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. Use one of: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-skin, human-oral, human-gut, human-vaginal, microbial mat|biofilm, miscellaneous, plant-associated, sediment, soil, wastewater|sludge, water

collection_timezone.definition: The timezone of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. UTC-7

collection_date.definition: The date of sampling. Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 2008-01-23

country.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1397)

samp_mat_process.definition: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v1.0) terms please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/40832

material.definition: The environmental material level refers to the matter that was displaced by the sample, prior to the sampling event. Environmental matter terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO terms listed under environmental matter can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00010483

feature.definition: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO terms listed under environmental feature can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00002297

longitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

isol_growth_condt.definition: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation of the sample

location.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific local region name
location.value: San Diego University, San Diego, California

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample

latitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

continent.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by continent.  Use one of: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, South America

collection_time.definition: The local time of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 19:23:10

country.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1397)

samp_mat_process.definition: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v1.0) terms please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/40832

material.definition: The environmental material level refers to the matter that was displaced by the sample, prior to the sampling event. Environmental matter terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO terms listed under environmental matter can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00010483

feature.definition: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO terms listed under environmental feature can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00002297

longitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

isol_growth_condt.definition: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation of the sample

location.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific local region name
location.value: San Diego University, San Diego, California

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample

latitude.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

continent.definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by continent.  Use one of: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, South America

collection_time.definition: The local time of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 19:23:10

lib_type.definition: Type of library used. For 454 only

metagenome_name.definition: Unique name for the sequences from this library
metagenome_name.value: Kent State SeaTech Morbid Fish Gut Viral Sample

seq_meth.definition: Sequencing method used. Use one of: Sanger, pyrosequencing, ABI-solid, 454, Illumina, assembeled, other

investigation_type.definition: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/16S rRNA sequencing

sample_name.definition: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

seq_center.definition: Name of instatute sequencing was done

biome.definition: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

samp_collect_device.definition: The method or device employed for isolating/collecting the sample
samp_collect_device.value: Microbial community was isolated May 4, 2006, from the slime layer of hybrid striped bass from Kent SeaTech (Salton Sea, CA) (33.537594, -116.097751). The fish were sick at time of sampling

env_package.definition: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. Use one of: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-skin, human-oral, human-gut, human-vaginal, microbial mat|biofilm, miscellaneous, plant-associated, sediment, soil, wastewater|sludge, water

collection_date.definition: The date of sampling. Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 2008-01-23
